titleStmt.title: Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 328/715

msIdentifier.repository: Gonville and Caius College, Lower Library
msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 328/715

msDesc.head: Bartholomew of San Concordio, Summa de Casibus Conscientiae

foliation.p: Written in pencil in the upper right-hand corners of the recto side of the first leaf of each quire.

signatures.p: Modern quire numbers (Arabic numerals) written in pencil in the lower right-hand corners of the first rectos of quires

binding.p: (?) Original red leather over wooden boards, with two indents on the upper and lower covers for clasps (now missing, but part of the catch-piece of the upper clasp on the rear cover remains); re-backed with brown leather and two paper pastedowns with Gonville and Caius shelfmark numbers printed in red ('715') and black ('328') ink.
A 17th-century title inscription on the front cover reads: Summa confessorum vel Summa de Casibus Conscientiae

The inside covers feature paper pastedowns with printed text in a vertical orientation. The two pastedowns have been made from a single page ('108') from a chapter (De privilegiis ex etcessi priuilegia) from an edition of Dominicus de Sancto Geminiano [Domenico da San Gimignano] (d. 1424)'s Lectura super sexto Decretalium (e.g. see Lectura sup sexto libro decretalium cum apostillis clarissimorum virorum Bernardini ex capitaneis de Landriano Joanis quoque de gradibus et postremo Celsi Hugo [...] (Piston, 1520), p. 268).

provenance.p: William Lyndwood (c. 1375-1446), Fellow of Pembroke College, Cambridge, but later became Doctor of Canon Law at Oxford Lyndwood, William, c. 1375-1446: ownership of the manuscript suggested by the copy of a letter addressed to him on f. 176v (see M.R. James (1908), I); considering Lyndwood's career at Oxford, it is of interest that one 15th-century addition refers to religious manuscripts for sale at a market in Oxford (f. [iii] verso), suggesting that the annotator was located there or, at least, familiar with the city.

John Sperhawke (fl. c. 1400-1474), Fellow of Pembroke Hall, Cambridge; Master of Arts and Doctor of Divinity (1453) Sperhawke, John, fl. c. 1400-1474: according to an inscription by a later owner on f. 176r: Liber quondam magistri Johannis Speyrhawke doctoris, prec. xxiiijs; for Sperhawk, see Emden (1963), p. 545).

history.acquisition: Arrived at Gonville and Caius College at an unknown date before 1697: its classmark numbers ('715' and '328') on printed labels pasted on the spine. Its armorial bookplate pasted on the inside of the upper cover of the former binding, inscribed with the classmark numbers '715' and '328'. Recorded as no. 813 in Edward Bernard's Catalogi librorum manuscriptorum Angliae et Hiberniae in unum collecti, 2 vols in one (Oxford: Theatro Sheldoniano, 1697).

recordHist.source: This catalogue entry partly draws on M.R. James, A descriptive catalogue of the manuscripts in the library of Gonville and Caius College, vol. 1 (Cambridge, 1908); and Kari Anne Rand Schmidt, Manuscripts in the Library of Gonville and Caius College, Cambridge (Cambridge: Brewer, 2001).

availability.p: Visitors to Gonville and Caius College who wish to consult Lower Library material are required to apply to the Library in advance of their visit. For information on eligibility and admission procedures see: Gonville and Caius College: Library Information.

monogr.title: Survey of the antiquities of the city of Oxford

imprint.publisher: Printed for the Oxford historical society at the Clarendon press

monogr.title: A descriptive catalogue of the manuscripts in the library of Gonville and Caius College
A biographical register of the University of Cambridge to 1500
Incipits of Latin works on the virtues and vices, 1100-1500 A.D.
Manuscripts in the Library of Gonville and Caius College, Cambridge

msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 328/715, ff. [i] recto-[iv] verso

msContents.textLang: Leaves from a Latin manuscript with marginal additions in Middle English

msItem.title: History of Rome [Ab urbe condita]
msItem.author: Livy [Titus Livius]
msItem.incipit: [i] recto statuit uirginitate aliisque cerimoniis uenerabiles ac sanctas fecit
msItem.explicit: Ad hoc Tullius nunciate in quid regi uestro regem romanum deos facere testes uter prius populus res repetentes legatos
msItem.note: These four folios are made from two consecutive leaves from a copy of Livy's Ab urbe condita, containing Book I.20-27; because the original two leaves were turned at a 45 degree angle and then folded vertically in order to create two bifolia, the original text is now in a vertical orientation.

msItem.title: Medical recipe for the eyes
msItem.textLang: Middle English recipe with a Latin title
msItem.incipit: [i] verso Take Eufrate . a goddele . rue . verueyne . Ã¾e sede of ffenel. and wasche all these . an drye . them in an horn . or in a potte and make powder. and Èeue a man to hete. and do Ã¾e jus of slou in hys eyyn.
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Theological note attributed to Isidore of Seville
msItem.incipit: [i] verso Isidorus. In hac enim vita deus partit impijs et tum non partit electis
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Theological poem
msItem.rubric: [ii] recto Subscripti et si incidant [...] pro absolucione habenda
msItem.incipit: [ii] recto Percuciens clericum Romam petat excipiuntur
msItem.explicit: [ii] recto Janitor officii ; claustralis uimque repellens Nec non vir fiat filius atque pater This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Theological poem
msItem.rubric: [ii] recto Simplex sacerdos in hiis casibus absoluere non potest [...]
msItem.incipit: [ii] recto Qui factis incestum ; deflorans aut homicida sacrilegusque parentum percussor sodomita
msItem.explicit: [ii] recto Symoniacus presbitero negueunt a simplice solui Pontificem super hiis deuotus semper adhibis
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: List of English kings and their reigns, from Edward III to Henry VI
msItem.incipit: [ii] recto Edwardus .3us. / regnavit lij. annos / Ricardus regnavit vicesimo .2o. / Henricus quartus regnavit xiiijo. / Henricus quintus regnauit xcim annos / Henricus sextus regnauit xxx annos.
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Casus papales
msItem.rubric: [ii] recto In hiis casibus penitentes [...] ad papam
msItem.incipit: [ii] recto Ad papam clericum feriens ; falsarium vrens Ecclesiam symon audens celebrare ligatus
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Declaration on Institution
msItem.incipit: [ii] recto In dei nomine Amen Coram vobis notanrio et testibus dico allego et propono ego clericus Lincollniensis diocesis
msItem.explicit: [ii] recto et 3o instanter instantissime mihi dari et tradi cum effectu etcaetera
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Note on angels
msItem.incipit: [ii] verso Quotiens homines bene operantur angeli domini assunt eis
msItem.explicit: [ii] verso sanguis domini ibi offertur
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Note on a runny nose
msItem.incipit: [ii] verso Corizat naris regnat in pectore tussis / ffans tenet aut guttur quicquid rancerus habetur
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Note on John de Grandisson [Grandison], Bishop of Exeter (1327-1369)
msItem.incipit: [ii] verso Dominus Johannes de Grandissono quondam Episcopus Exoniensis correxit epistolas et euangelia eiusdem ecclesie templar textus euangeliorum Offe quondam regis anglorum qui erat scriptus tempore Caroli magni post exemplar beati Jeronimi
msItem.explicit: [ii] verso sed attentdat quod idem pater non nisi per magnos labores supeflua resecando et diminuta suplenda eadem emendauit
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcribed in James (1907), I, pp. 370-371.

msItem.title: Theological note on marriage
msItem.incipit: [iii] recto Nota quod tribus de causis ducitur uxor: causa prolis . causa adiutorij . causa incontinencie
msItem.explicit: [iii] recto et femine sub viri potestate consistant
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Theological note about the life of the Virgin Mary
msItem.incipit: [iii] recto Nota quod sancta maria fuit etatis xiiij annorum antequam Christus natus est et xxxij annis cum domino vixit cum eo et post passionem Christi vixit xvj annis qui faciunt lxij annos in domino.
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Canon law on theft from the Church
msItem.incipit: [iii] recto Nota quod in canone reperitur qui abstulit patri vel matri et dicit hoc peccatum non esse . homicidij particeps est; ergo qui Christi pecunias et ecclesie rapit homicida est
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Form of excommunication
msItem.incipit: [iii] recto Auctoritate dei patris omnipotentis et filij et spiritus sancti et gloriose virginis marie et beatorum apostolorum petri et pauli
msItem.explicit: Et sicut hec lucerna extinguitur ipsi nisi ad condignam emendacionem et satisfaccionem resipuerint fiat fiat amen
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Theological note on the five ways in which a husband who abuses his wife sins
msItem.incipit: [iii] recto Nota quod 5 modis peccat maritus abutens vxore
msItem.explicit: [iii] recto 5o quando fit contra naturale modum
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Poem on meals of the day
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso Gentamur mane ; cenamur vespere facto / Tercia prandere vult hora requirit habere / Merendam nona messor lassatus in hora
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem on the virtues of Scabiosa
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso ffert scabiosa pilos veruena habet illos
msItem.explicit: [iii] verso Potata novies fit de languente boni spes
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Poem on the virtues of Cumin [from De viribus herbarum]
msItem.author: Floridus Macer
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso Esse putatur medici siccum calidumque criminum
msItem.explicit: [iii] verso Et fluxum ventris in aceto stringere coctum
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Poem on the virtues of Sinapis [from De viribus herbarum]
msItem.author: Floridus Macer
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso Exprimitur sutus tenera de caule sinapis / Quem succum mandens dentis tormenta fugabis
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem on the virtues of Cinnamon [from De viribus herbarum]
msItem.author: Floridus Macer
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso Cinamonia duas species dicuntur habere
msItem.explicit: [iii] verso Reptilium morsuus curat si lungitur illis
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Poem on the virtues of Coriander [from De viribus herbarum]
msItem.author: Floridus Macer
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso ffrigida vis herbe . coriandri dicitur esse
msItem.explicit: [iii] verso Cum vino vel si mixto sumatur aceto
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Poem on the virtues of Lettuce [from De viribus herbarum]
msItem.author: Floridus Macer
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso ffrigida lactuce vis constat et humida valde
msItem.explicit: [iii] verso hiis quibus assiduo fuerit cibus ejus in esu [sic: usu]
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Note on the number of days in the year
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso Memorandum quod sunt in anno ccclxv dies vnde computando quolibet die vnum [? bz] fieri erit summa totalis xls quart. j [? bz]
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: List of religious books for sale on Jaudewin's market, Oxford
msItem.textLang: Latin with a single English word
msItem.rubric: [iii] verso ffiat [? sanctuarium] in foro vide libris subscriptis si poterint nuncupato Jandewyn ibi venales reperiri - market
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso vid: [? Omni bene presiuit] / Legenda sanctorum / Speculum ecclesie / Abstinencia / Gemma sacerdotalis
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

Full transcription; the titles include Jacobus de Voragine's Legenda Aurea; Edmund of Abingdon's Speculum ecclesie; and Gerald of Wales's Gemma Ecclesiastica. For Jaudewin's market, see Wood, City of Oxford (1889), I. p. 371.

msItem.title: Note about English coins
msItem.incipit: [iv] recto Per dispocionem tocius regni anglie fuit vna mensura domini Regis compositi videlict ad denarius anglicanus qui vocatur sterlingus rotundus et sine tonsura ponserabit triginta duo grana frumenti in medio spice et xxti denarii faciunt vnam vnciam et duodecim vncie facient libram argenti et octo libre frumenti facient lagenam et octo lagene facient bussellum et octo [bz] facient quarterium
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Verse on pride and shame
msItem.incipit: [iv] recto ffastus precedit . sequitur pudor et male ledit
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem on vices in youth and old age
msItem.incipit: [iv] recto Qui non assuestit uirtutibus dum iuuenescit / A viciis nescit discedere . quando senescit
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem on the transitoriness of life
msItem.incipit: [iv] recto Est homo flos fenum duransque tempore parvo / Nunc est nunc non est vt flos qui crescit in aruo"
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription; based on Job 14:1â2.

msItem.title: Poem on the bite of death
msItem.incipit: [iv] recto Post mortis morsum vertit dilectio dorsum / ffinita vita finit amicus ita
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem
msItem.incipit: [iv] recto Quantus erit luctus iudex cum dixerit ite / Tantus erit fructus cum dixerit ipse venite
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem
msItem.incipit: [iv] recto Sit tibi lucerna lex fraus pellis que paterna / Sede sede ista iudex inflexibilis sta
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem
msItem.incipit: [iv] recto Pater pacis periit sapienciam secum sustulit / Regna Rome ruent fumo fame ferro / Mutus sit iudex fraus est mercator in orbe
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem
msItem.incipit: [iv] recto Lex non est dominis nec timor est pueris / Ingenium dolus est amor omnis luxus habetur / Ludus scurrilitas gula [...] festa dies.
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Verse riddle on the oak tree
msItem.incipit: [iv] recto Dum vixi vivos paui nunc mortua vivos / Porto nunc [...] pascunt superambulo viuos
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Two verse lines from Juvenal's Satirae
msItem.author: Juvenal
msItem.incipit: [iv] recto Nil habet infelix paupertas durius in se / Quam quod ridiculos homines facit
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso Hec septem remouent hominem culpam venialem
msItem.explicit: [iii] verso visio sacra dei benedictio presulis omnis
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Poem
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso Roma manus rodit quos rodere non valet odit / Lex est defuncta quia iudicis est manus vncta / [? Civus] ob vnguentum ius est in carcere tentum
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso Sanguine subtracto ne fumas protinus estas
msItem.explicit: [iii] verso Et sanguine proprium redeat vsque locum
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Poem
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso Dat vinum purum tibi ter tria comoda primo
msItem.explicit: [iii] verso Sit mensura comes ; ne violetur opus
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Verse
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso Res vis res porta pro verbis verba reporta
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso Secretum porto quod inter nos habeatur / Si conuertatur medium non stabit in orto
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem
msItem.incipit: [iv] recto Sepe vitupero rem vel iudico deteriorem / Propter liuorem vel quia nescio rem
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: The numbers one to ten in Roman and Arabic numerals
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso i ij iij iiij v vj vij viij ix x / 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Moral poem
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso Si sapiens fore vis sex serua que tibi mando / Quid dicas et vbi de quo cui quimodo quando
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem on three joys and three sorrows
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso Sunt tria gaudia pax paciencia copia rerum / Sunt tria tristia lis et inedia fraus mulierum
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso Tu qui das potum ciphum circum spice totum / Tu qui das potum ciphum circumspcie totum / vt tua det dextra mundum vas intus et extra
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso ffemina gemina merum tria sunt per optima rerum
msItem.explicit: [iii] verso Semina sunt scelerum . femina . gemina . merum
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Poem
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso Cui satis est quod habet satis illum constat habere /
msItem.explicit: [iii] verso Et non paupertas sed mentis yacus egentum
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Poem
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso Non est presbiteri viridi sub veste videri
msItem.explicit: [iii] verso Non est in veste vicium si viuis honeste
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Poem
msItem.incipit: [iii] verso Si tibi dum puer es fuerit sapiencia vilis
msItem.explicit: [iii] verso Cum fueris quod vis probat accio [...] tua quid sis
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Model indenture concerning tithes
msItem.incipit: [iv] verso Universis pateat per presentes quod ego C de A talis diocesis
msItem.explicit: [iv] verso In cuius rei testimonium sigillum meum presentibus est appensum. Dat. ectaetera
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: The Creed
msItem.incipit: [iv] verso Yc bileue in god fadir almychti y that makede heuene and vrthe of noght
msItem.explicit: [iv] verso yc bileue in the holy gost and in holy churche in the menschip of halgh in forgift of synne in bodiliche arysyngge and in the life that ys euerelastyngge amen.
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcribed in Rand Schmidt (2001), p. 59.

listBibl.bibl: For other copies, see Rand Schimidt (2001), p. 59.

msItem.title: Pater Noster
msItem.incipit: [iv] verso Fadir oure that ert in heuene yhalghid beo thy name
msItem.explicit: [iv] verso and ne led thou ous noght into fonddyngge bote delyuere ous of alle wikkede thyngge amen so beo hyt
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

listBibl.bibl: For other copies, see Rand Schimidt (2001), p. 59.

msItem.title: Ave Maria
msItem.incipit: [iv] verso Hayle beo thou marie foel of grace god beo wyth the y blesside beo then among alle wymmen and yblessid beo the freut of thi wome iesus amen so beo hit etcaetera
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcribed in Rand Schmidt (2001), p. 59.

listBibl.bibl: For other copies, see Rand Schimidt (2001), p. 60.

extent.seg: Fragments, comprising two leaves of a manuscript, rotated 90 degrees and folded in half to form two bifolia.

dimensions.p: These measurements are based on the current orientation of ff. [i] recto-[iv] verso and not on the original two larger leaves from which the first four folios were made; although the measurements of the textual layout (below) are based on the original (horizontal) orientation of the text, it is not possible to give accurate measurements of the height and width of the original leaves due to cropping.

supportDesc.condition: The text on f. [i] recto has faded and that on f. [i] verso is partially obscure by paper fragments, indicating that this side of the leaf was once a pastedown on the inside cover.

dimensions.p: These measurements are based on the text as it would have been visible on the two original leaves from which ff. [i] recto-[iv] verso have been made; i.e. the lines of text running horizontally.

p.seg: Ruled in leadpoint, frame and line ruling. Double columns. About 58 lines to the page, written below top line.

layout.p: The other texts in this Part have been written into the blank spaces around the fragmentary text of Livy, by several hands, so it is not possible to record written dimensions or ruling practices for these.

handNote.p: Copied by a single hand in a Northern Textualis script.
Additions copied by several hands in cursive Anglicana scripts.

decoDesc.p: This part of the manuscript does not feature any significant forms of decoration.

origin.note: M.R. James suggests Italy as a place of origin but the script leaves open the possibility that the leaves were copied in England as well.

msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 328/715, ff. [v]-[viii], 1-198

msItem.title: Collection of verses and riddles
msItem.incipit: [v] recto Cum peccare nequis si tu peccata relinguis / Non tu peccata sed te peccata relinqunt
msItem.explicit: [v] recto Lingua breuis serenitate leuis leuitate monetur mobilitate loquarum ; garulitate uocens

msItem.title: Theological quotations
msItem.incipit: [v] recto Ambrosius - Non sine dolore amittitur quod cum magno amore possidetur
msItem.explicit: [v] verso Augustinus - Noli vinci a malo set vinci in bono malum / Si inimicus tuus efurit ciba illum si scitit pota illum / Tribulacio angustia persecucio fames ambiguitas periculum seperat hominem a caritate Christi
msItem.note: The excerpts are attributed to, respectively, Ambrose, Augustine, Ciprian, Isidore, Jerome, Gregory, and Bernard of Clairvaux.
This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Definition of the works of corporal and spiritual mercy
msItem.incipit: [v] verso Nota - quod misericordia corporalis est dare esurienti cibum
msItem.explicit: [v] verso Nota - Misericordia spiritualis - Insipientem docere consolari dolentem exortari bene agentem ad humilitatem et satisfaccionem prouotare delinquentem
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Tract on the six properties of fire
msItem.incipit: [vi] recto In igne sex nature videntur adesse . prima que comburit stipulas et paleas .2a. que purgat aurum et argentum .3a. que frigus et tenebras depellit .4a. que calorem et lucem ingerit .5a. que dura mitigat .6a. que mollia durat
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Theological notes on confession, obedience, the soul, sin,
msItem.incipit: [vi] recto Valet et confessio propter erubescentiam sibi adiunctam que magna pars est satisffacionis
msItem.explicit: [viii] verso et sic uirtute ipsius fugabitur venenum peccati a corde
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Summa de Casibus Conscientiae
msItem.author: Bartholomew of San Concordio
msItem.incipit: 1r Qvoniam vt ait gregorius super ezechiel nullum omnipotenti deo tale sacrificium est quale zelus animarum
msItem.explicit: 173r ss. .i. si vero aliquis dolereta de bono alterius in quantum alter excedit ipsum in bonis tunc est invidia ut dictum est supra invidia est supra inuidia ss. secundo
msItem.note: Two 15th-century hands have added a title to f. 1r, each writing one half: Iste liber vocatur summa confessorum . siue summa de casibus consciencie. The hand that wrote siue summa... etc also wrote an explicit to f. 173r: Explicit summa de casibus conscientie secundum compilacionem fratris Bartholomei de piss ordinis predicatorum. This same hand appears to have written the note relating to John Speyrhawke on f. 176r. See Provenance for further details.

msItem.title: Theological notes
msItem.incipit: 173v Nota quod paruulus cum lesus fuerit currit ad matrem suam plangendo
msItem.explicit: 174r Quod sicut origo est aquarum . Sic cogitacio
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Quotations attributed to St Augustine
msItem.incipit: 174v Augustinus . Plus potest deus dimittere . quam homo possit peccare
msItem.explicit: 174v Augustinus . Plus ualet cordis contricio quam totius mundi peregrinacio
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Poem on catechetical teachings
msItem.incipit: 174v Hec sunt principue senioribus insinuanda
msItem.explicit: 174v In quibus erratur ; quid vitandum quid agendum
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Poem on England
msItem.incipit: 174v Ecce geniit anglia cordibus imbuta / Gens geniit tristicia cordibus polluta / Vocat pestilencia
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Note on good things
msItem.incipit: 174v Notandum quod quedam sunt bona in se et ad aliud et quedam bona ad aliud et non in se . quedam bona in se et non ad aliud
msItem.explicit: 174v Bona in se et non aliud vt que bona sunt in sui natura tum ad aliud mala . venenum enim bonum est quantum ad sui naturam . quantum ad aliud malum .que conficiendo destruit
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Note on the three-fold life of mankind
msItem.incipit: 174v Triplex vita . scilicet vita nature . vita gracie . vita glorie. Vita nature viunt boni et mali. Vita gracie iusti viatores. Vita glorie beati comprehensores
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Note on three perfections [perhaps extract from Thomas Aquinas, Scriptum super Libros Sententiarum Petri Lombardi]
msItem.author: Thomas Aquinas
msItem.incipit: 174v Triplex perfeccio . scilicet perfeccio nature . perfeccio gracie . perfeccio glorie
msItem.explicit: 174v Perfeccio glorie erit in fine seculorum . Et quia perfeccio gracie est medium inter vtrumque . Ideo Christus per quem gracia facta est circa medium seculorum venit. Abakuc tercio. In medio amorum notum facies.
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Verse
msItem.incipit: 174v Impetuosus homo numquam dolor carebit
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Poem on penitence
msItem.incipit: 174v Latrine delent peccata . sicut spongia aque delet sanguinem a ueste
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem on life
msItem.incipit: 174v Qui modicum mihi dat. me viuere longius optat. Me vult vitalem qui dat mihi rem modicalem
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem on signs of God
msItem.incipit: 174v Si sis ex dignis hijs iiijor accipe signis / Audi plange caue fac te deus eruet aue
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem on martyrs
msItem.incipit: 174v Est martir macerans carnem inuenis quoque castus / [?V]ives egens pauper largus paciens tribulatus
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem on Eve and Ave
msItem.incipit: 174v Viuere si sine re vis cum sis filius eue / ffunde frequenter aue domine que liberat aue
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem on love
msItem.incipit: 174v Non fundamentum ponas ; amore potentum / ffamina pulchra serunt commoda pau[c]a ferunt
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Verses on the Four Humours
msItem.incipit: 174v Largus . amans. hillaris. ridens. rubie que coloris / Cantans. carvosus. satis audax atque benignus - Sangineus
msItem.explicit: 174v Inuidus et tristis . cupidus. dextre que tenacis. / Non expars fraudis . cupdus lcei que coloris - Malencolicus
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Mnemonic verse for the names of the Apostles
msItem.incipit: 175r Jo bap atque pe pau. iac. lau. super bartholome. nat. / Math. sim. om. sanctorum andree. thoma. que natalis / Mathie . Pasche. tunc ascen. pen. trinitatis
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Theological notes on priests, the Eucharist, charity
msItem.incipit: 175r Sacerdos qui est sine peccato mortalibus e tin bono proposito bene viuendi
msItem.explicit: 176r Quis nos seprabit a caritate Christi etcatera
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Letter of Henry Chichele, Archbishop of Canterbury (1414-1443) to William Lyndwood
msItem.author: Henry Chichele
msItem.incipit: 176v Henricus permissione diuina Cantuariensis Archiepiscopus tocius anglie primas et apostolice sedis legatus. dilecto in Christo filio Magistro Willelmo Lyndewode vtriusque iuris doctori Curie nostre Cantuariensis Officiali Salutem graciam
msItem.explicit: 176v Datum in manerio nostro de Croydon decimo dei mensis Marcij Anno domini Millesimo CCCC decimo none et nostre translacionis anno exto
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

In the letter, Chichele gives Lyndwood power to act in a suit about tithes between John Drury alias "Salisbury Rector" of the parish church of Stortford, and Thomas Ryngstede, Rector of Farnham, both in the London diocese, dated Croydon, 10 March 1419.

msItem.title: Theological notes
msItem.incipit: 176v Beda momentanea est fornicacionis delectacio et eterna erit fornicatoris pena
msItem.explicit: 177r Confessio oris signum est causa sue patis cum deo. Confessio commendabilis
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Three medical recipes
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
The purposes of the recipes has not been specified.

msItem.title: Single sentence
msItem.incipit: 177v Est dieta cibus moderatus iter que diei
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
full transcription.

msItem.title: Theological note
msItem.incipit: 177v Qui in confessione mentitur deo mentitur cui sit confessio in psalmo / Confitemini domino quoniam bonus etcaetera
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
full transcription.

msItem.title: Method to clarify honey
msItem.incipit: 176v Est nota quod est modus clarificandi mel. Ponatur mel in olla sive patella et lento igne dequoquatur
msItem.explicit: 176v Et postquam potus te reddiderit se clarum ; potetur mane diluculo quantum sufficiat ad quantum mediocrem
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Poem on deception by biblical women
msItem.incipit: 177v Adam sampsonem david lot et salomonem / ffemina decepit . quis tunc tutus erit
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Method to prepare honey
msItem.incipit: 177v Modus faciendi mel. In primis Apiatur mel de singulis vasis et ponatur in uno Trendello magno
msItem.explicit: 177v Et postea reponatur in vna cupa vel Trendallo et eodem vase permutatur stare per octo dies et tunc ponatur in vno doleo vel vtre bene mundato et fortiter legato
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Method to make wax
msItem.incipit: 177v Ad faciendum Ceram. Ponatur cera in vna patella in qua prius apponatur modica aqua
msItem.explicit: 177v et sit infundatur in vno Pelui vel Patella et ponatur vna cordula in eadem cera liquida vt per hanc postea ponderettur
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Poem on biblical figures martyred by Roman emperors
msItem.incipit: 178r Antipas herodes baptistam decapitauit / Occidit pueros herodes ascolonites / Agrippa iacobum . claudens incarcere petrum
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Poem on the "Quadriga"
msItem.incipit: 178r Littera gesta docet . quid credis allegoria / Moralis quid agas : quo tendas anagogia
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
The poem covers the four interpretations of the Bible: the historical, typological (allegorical), tropological (moral), and anagogical interpretation.
Full transcription.

msItem.title: Exemplum
msItem.incipit: 178r Narratur quod quidam qui multa bona in vita sua adquisiuit . iacuit in ianuis mortis et dixit sibi confessa quod reddat debitum
msItem.explicit: 178r Hec est iusticia enim. ideomemoriam eius habeatis et diligatis iusticiam qui indicatis terram
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.

msItem.title: Theological excerpts
msItem.incipit: 178r Origines . Prima quamuis sit exigua non despicitur aput iustum iudicem
msItem.explicit: 178r Augustinus . lege et relege totam sacram paginam et nichil inuenies terribilius quam continuare in illo statu in quo non es ausus mori
msItem.note: This text has been added in the 15th century.
The excerpts have been attributed to Origen, Gregory the Great, and Augustine.

signatures.p: Leaf signatures consisting of letters and Roman numerals in red, but sometimes cropped off.

catchwords.seg: Catchwords in frames of brown ink with decorative flowers

p.seg: Ruled in leadpoint, frame only. Double columns, except for the fifteenth-century additions on ff. [vi] recto-[viii] verso and ff. 173v-174r, 175r-177v. 49-50 lines to the page, written below top line.

handNote.p: ff. 1r-173r have been copied by a single scribe in an Anglicana script.
The additions on ff. [v] recto-[v] verso have been copied by two hands in Anglicana scripts.
The additions on ff. [v] recto-[viii] verso and ff. 173v-178r have been copied by various hands, mostly producing cursive Anglicana scripts.

decoNote.p: One partial (3-sided) 'J' border in blue and red ink on f. 1r.
Large (2, 3, or 4 lines) blue initials in frames of red penwork decoration with pen-flourishing in red ink throughout.
Paraphs in blue or red ink.
Small (2 lines) red initials in the fifeenth-century additions on ff. [v] recto-[viii] verso, and ff. 174v-176r.
Underlining in red in the fifeenth-century additions on ff. [v] recto-[viii] verso, and ff. 174v-176r.
Paraphs in red in the fifeenth-century additions on ff. [v] recto-[viii] verso, and ff. 174v-176r.

origin.origDate: Copied in the second half of the 14th century.

change.persName: Dr Clarck Drieshen, Project Cataloguer, Cambridge University Library
